Mailing Address: The Senate of Canada140 Wellington St, Suite 900Ottawa, ON     K1A 0A4
Service Details: Senator for the province of British Columbia- The Senate is the upper house in Canada's bicameral parliamentary democracy- It was created to counterbalance representation by population in the House of Commons- Recently, the Senate has come to bolster representation of groups often underrepresented in Parliament, such as Aboriginal Peoples, visible minorities and women- Was also intended to provide Parliament with a second chance to consider bills before they are passed- Senators may pass bills, propose amendments to them or vote to defeat them
